algorithm_technique: Binary search using bisect_right to find insertion point
problem_summary_simple: Find the smallest character in a sorted list that is greater than a target character.
problem_summary_technical: Utilizes binary search (bisect_right) on a sorted character array to efficiently find the smallest element greater than the target.
key_insights: The sorted nature of the input array is a strong indicator for binary search.
bisect_right is crucial for finding the first element strictly greater than the target.
Handling the wrap-around case (target greater than all elements) is important.
